channel.title: EasyRSC Not Working
channel.description:
Can't seem to get EasyRSC Working, the client runs and works fine but the server part of it does not work [img]http://i.imgur.com/AhIozE1.png[/img]
That's the best screenshot i can get of what happens, also the compile part on the server does not work either.. i don't understand what exactly i'm doing that's making it not work

item.title: EasyRSC Not Working
item.dc:creator: @marc110 marc110
item.description:
@marc110 wrote:

Crooks:

It’s because you don’t use Java 6. There are 2 ways here… Either you add a constructor to invItem class or you switch to Java 6 so you don’t have to deal with it. Make sure you have uninstalled Java 7.

this is correct , i asked this last week , you need to make a account on the java website to get 6 and there removing it soon

for some reason the server won’t load on java 7

i would download java 6 and back it up

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC Not Working
item.dc:creator: @Crooks Crooks
item.description:
@Crooks wrote:

It’s because you don’t use Java 6. There are 2 ways here… Either you add a constructor to invItem class or you switch to Java 6 so you don’t have to deal with it. Make sure you have uninstalled Java 7.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC Not Working
item.dc:creator: @0xCAFEBABE 0xCAFEBABE
item.description:
@0xCAFEBABE wrote:

The class “org.rscdaemon.server.model.InvItem” does not have a constructor with 0 (zero) parameter arguments. That is at least one of your problems (in case there are more errors that I cannot see on that image).

Read full topic
